definitions: The first letter of the English alphabet.
Used to indicate an indefinite quantity or number.
Having the power or ability to do something.
Capable of being done.
Near or around.
Approximately.
In a higher position than.
Superior to.
From one side to the other.
So as to pass over.
Coming after in time or order.
In pursuit of.
Once more.
In addition.
In a position opposite to or facing.
In opposition to.
The whole quantity or amount.
Every one of a group.
The first person singular present tense of the verb to be.
Used to express existence.
A word used before a singular noun that begins with a vowel sound.
Used to indicate something that is not specified.
A coordinating conjunction used to join words, phrases, or clauses.
Used to indicate addition.
Used to refer to one or more people or things, without specifying which.
Used to indicate that something is possible.
The third person plural present tense of the verb to be.
Used to express existence.
A conjunction used to introduce a clause that explains or modifies something else.
Used to indicate similarity.
In or to a particular place.
Used to indicate the time of something.
The most common verb in the English language, used to indicate existence, occurrence, or possession.
Used to form the progressive tenses of other verbs.
A conjunction used to introduce a clause that gives a reason for something.
Used to indicate cause and effect.
The past participle of the verb to be.
Used to indicate a state of being.
In a previous time or place.
Used to indicate a prior event.
